means: （地方）被太阳晒得发硬的，阳光炽烈的

sentence.Network_en: In sunbaked southern Italy, fires raged as parched forests and fields turned to tinder.
sentence.Network_cn: 太阳炙烤下的意大利南部, 大火蔓延,被晒干了的树林和田地都成了天然的燃料.

sentence.Network_en: The landscape varies from endless sunbaked horizons to dense tropical rainforest to chilly southern beaches.
sentence.Network_cn: 景观多变,从无一望无尽视野到稠密的热带雨林到寒冷的南部海滩.

entry.def: Sun-baked land or earth has been made hard and dry by the sun shining on it.

example.tran: 被太阳晒得又干又硬的草地

means.word_mean: 1. dried out by heat or excessive exposure to sunlight;
2. baked or hardened by exposure to sunlight; not burned;

auth_sentence.content: Each still appeared sunbaked with strong ceramic traces of her starter glamour.
